div.p: Hi, I’m Francis Maude. I’m minister for the cabinet office. I have the pleasure of
having responsibility for the government’s policy of digital by default.
These days, people’s expectations are very high of how they do things in their ordinary
life. People don’t think of doing things digitally as being about technology; it’s
just part of their life. And so much that they do is done online. If you’re booking
an airline ticket, anything like that, you do it online. But in government, we’re way,
way behind, which gives us a fantastic opportunity to do things really better. That’s what
we’re doing. There’s less money around so we need to do it more cheaply as well as
giving citizens a better experience. We made a lot of progress moving onto gov.uk,
which is going to be so much easier for people to get information about what’s going on
in government. Now we need to move the next step to get transactions done online.
We’ve got lots of good examples of that, but people don’t use them enough, and we
need to make these applications absolutely compelling so that it’s so intuitive, it’s
so easy, it’s such a natural thing to do that people don’t even think twice about
whether they renew their car tax online or any other of the myriad different things that
we have to do with government. So I’m really excited with this. There’s a huge amount
to do, but so much upside from it, there’s so much ability for us to do things better
and give our citizens a better experience. That’s what we’re here for. Thanks.
